009package imagingbook.testutils;
010
011import static org.junit.Assert.assertNotNull;
012import static org.junit.Assert.assertTrue;
013
014import java.io.File;
015import java.util.Arrays;
016import java.util.HashSet;
017
018import imagingbook.core.resource.ImageResource;
019import imagingbook.core.resource.NamedResource;
020
021/**
022 * Static methods for testing implementations of {@link NamedResource} and {@link ImageResource}.
023 * This class is duplicated in various projects since it is only available during the
024 * test phase and thus not contained in any dependency JAR. 
025 * 
026 * @author WB
027 */
028public abstract class ResourceTestUtils {
029        
030        /**
031         * Scans all resources defined by the specified {@link NamedResource} class and
032         * validates that they exist.
033         * 
034         * @param clazz enum class implementing {@link NamedResource}
035         * @return the number of validated resources
036         */
037        public static int testNamedResource(Class<? extends NamedResource> clazz) {
038                assertTrue("NamedResource class must be an enum type", clazz.isEnum());
039                assertTrue("class must implement " + NamedResource.class, 
040                                NamedResource.class.isAssignableFrom(clazz));
041                
042                String[] names = NamedResource.getResourceFileNames(clazz);
043                HashSet<String> hs = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(names));
044                
045                int n = 0;
046                for (NamedResource res : clazz.getEnumConstants()) {
047                        assertTrue(hs.contains(res.getFileName()));     // check if resource file exists (case sensitive!)
048        
049                        assertNotNull(res.getRelativePath());
050                        assertNotNull(new File(res.getRelativePath()));
051                        assertNotNull(res.getURL());
052                        assertNotNull("could not find resource " + res.toString(), res.getURL());
053                        n++;
054                }
055                return n;
056        }
057        
058        /**
059         * Scans all resources defined by some {@link ImageResource} class and
060         * validates that they can be opened as images.
061         * 
062         * @param clazz enum class implementing {@link ImageResource}
063         * @return the number of validated image resources
064         */
065        public static int testImageResource(Class<? extends ImageResource> clazz) {
066                assertTrue("ImageResource class must be an enum type", clazz.isEnum());
067                assertTrue("class must implement " + ImageResource.class, 
068                                ImageResource.class.isAssignableFrom(clazz));
069                
070                String[] names = ImageResource.getResourceFileNames(clazz);
071                HashSet<String> hs = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(names));
072                
073                int n = 0;
074                for (ImageResource res : clazz.getEnumConstants()) {
075                        
076                        assertTrue("image file not found: " + res.getURL(), 
077                                        hs.contains(res.getFileName()));        // check if resource file exists (case sensitive!)
078                        
079                        assertNotNull(res.getRelativePath());
080                        
081                        File file = new File(res.getRelativePath());
082//                      assertNotNull(file);
083//                      System.out.println("file can read = " + file.canRead());
084                        
085//                      System.out.println("URL = " + res.getURL());
086//                      System.out.println("expected name " + res.getFileName());
087//                      System.out.println("   is in Jar: " + res.isInsideJar());
088                
089                        assertNotNull("could not find resource " + file.getAbsolutePath(), res.getURL());       
090                        assertNotNull("could not open image for resource " + res,  res.getImage());
091                        n++;
092                }
093                return n;
094        }
095
096}
